frame.name: Location_in_time
frame.definition:
<def-root>The word(s) in this frame detail a particular moment in time.These often occur with demonstratives such as this and that.
<ex><fex name="Relative_time">Late</fex> that <fex name="Focal_time"><t>day</t></fex>, <fex name="Whole">1776</fex>, America declared sovereignty.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relative_time
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Relative_time</fen> denotes words that locate the time with respect to an identifiable reference point. <ex></ex> <ex>The <fex name="Relative_time">last</fex> <t>day</t> <fex name="Whole">of June</fex>, market crashed.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Name</fen> denotes the name of the particular point in time. <ex></ex> <ex>Make sure you lock the doors at <fex name="Name">closing</fex> <t>time</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Whole</fen> describes the larger unit of which the target word describes one part. If there is an appositive that is necessarily larger, it's the <fen>Whole</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex>What <t>time</t> <fex name="Whole">of day</fex> is it?</ex>
<ex> On that <t>day</t>, <fex name="Whole">1449</fex>, a battle raged.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Focal_time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The particular, salient point in time. If a specified time is present, it is the focal time. Otherwise, the unit is the focal time. If there is an appositive that specifies an entity that it not necessarily larger than the target, both the unit and the specification are the FE. <ex></ex> <ex>I didn't see it at that <fex name="Focal_time"><t>time</t></fex>.</ex>
<ex>The <t>time</t> is <fex name="Focal_time">10:00</fex>.</ex>
<ex>That <fex name="Focal_time"><t>day</t></fex>, <fex name="Focal_time">Dec. 7th</fex>, will live in infamy.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Salient_event
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Salient_event</fen> is an event that is associated with the given point in time. <ex></ex> <ex>It is <t>time</t> <fex name="Salient_event">to go</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Descriptor</fen> is any characterization or description of the point in time that is not covered by a more specific FE. <ex></ex> <ex> <fex name="Focal_time">WWII</fex> was a <fex name="Descriptor">strange</fex> <t>time</t> to be an American.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: time.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a particular moment in time

lexUnit.name: date.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a particular combination of a day, month, and year, possibly connected to an event happening at that time

lexUnit.name: day.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: An unspecified date in time.
